nodes.bodyText: This is a matter of taste but can we take off the Warning bit? It's important for people implementing the interface, but most people looking at the javadoc will just be interested in using it. Perhaps turn it into an @implNote entry.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -13,6 +13,9 @@ /** * An RDF* triple. Triples have a subject, predicate and object. Unlike {@link Statement}, a triple never has an * associated context. + *

+ * Warning / In order to ensure interoperability of concrete classes implementing this interface,

nodes.bodyText: @implNote sounds indeed more correct: updated javadocs to this end.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -13,6 +13,9 @@ /** * An RDF* triple. Triples have a subject, predicate and object. Unlike {@link Statement}, a triple never has an * associated context. + *

+ * Warning / In order to ensure interoperability of concrete classes implementing this interface,

nodes.bodyText: The same warning is present also on BNode/IRI/Literal in #2538 and it would be better to keep things aligned: where should we address this? new PR?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -13,6 +13,9 @@ /** * An RDF* triple. Triples have a subject, predicate and object. Unlike {@link Statement}, a triple never has an * associated context. + *

+ * Warning / In order to ensure interoperability of concrete classes implementing this interface,

nodes.bodyText: @knoan sorry, I missed that. Yeah, separate PR I think since those changes are only on the develop branch (and this is a quick fix for the master branch). Not massively urgent though.
